Package Custom_CollectionsED.stack

Class LinkedStack<T>

java.lang.Object
Custom_CollectionsED.stack.LinkedStack<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the data type to be used in the structure
All Implemented Interfaces:
StackADT<T>
public class LinkedStack<T> extends Object implements StackADT<T>
This class is an implementation is the stack data structure, which uses a singly linked list as a support.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    LinkedStack()
    default constructor, which creates an empty stack

    T
    pop()
    The pop method: Checks if the stack is empty Saves the current top of the stack so that it can later be returned The top is now the node which succeeds it The result is returned, and the count is decremented
    void
    push(T element)
    The push method: Creates a new node, with the value that was passed as a parameter This new node sits on top of the stack, so, its next field will be set to the previous top of the stack The top is now the new node, and the count is incremented

  • Constructor Details

    • LinkedStack

      public LinkedStack()
      default constructor, which creates an empty stack

  • Method Details

    • push

      public void push(T element)
        The push method:
      • Creates a new node, with the value that was passed as a parameter
      • This new node sits on top of the stack, so, its next field will be set to the previous top of the stack
      • The top is now the new node, and the count is incremented
      Specified by:
      push in interface StackADT<T>
      Parameters:
      element - to be added to the stack

    • pop

      public T pop() throws EmptyCollectionException
        The pop method:
      • Checks if the stack is empty
      • Saves the current top of the stack so that it can later be returned
      • The top is now the node which succeeds it
      • The result is returned, and the count is decremented
      Specified by:
      pop in interface StackADT<T>
      Returns:
      the element removed, previous top
      Throws:
      EmptyCollectionException - is the collection is empty at the time of access

    • peek

      public T peek() throws EmptyCollectionException
      Specified by:
      peek in interface StackADT<T>
      Returns:
      a reference to the value stored at the top of the stack
      Throws:
      EmptyCollectionException - in case the collection is empty at the moment of access

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Specified by:
      isEmpty in interface StackADT<T>
      Returns:
      true if the stack is empty, false otherwise

    • size

      public int size()
      Specified by:
      size in interface StackADT<T>
      Returns:
      the amount of elements in the stack

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Specified by:
      toString in interface StackADT<T>
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string representation of the stack
